terms.title: Announcement
terms.definition: A gossip message sent between peers intended to aid the discovery of a channel or a node.

terms.title: chain_hash
terms.definition: The uniquely identifying hash of the target blockchain (usually the genesis hash). This allows nodes to create and reference channels on several blockchains. Nodes are to ignore any messages that reference a chain_hash that are unknown to them. Unlike bitcoin-cli, the hash is not reversed but is used directly.

terms.title: main_chain_bitcoin_chain_hash
terms.definition: The uniquely identifying hash of the target blockchain (usually the genesis hash). This allows nodes to create and reference channels on several blockchains.

terms.title: Channel
terms.definition: A fast, off-chain method of mutual exchange between two peers. To transact funds, peers exchange signatures to create an updated commitment transaction.

terms.title: Closing_transaction
terms.definition: A transaction generated as part of a mutual close. A closing transaction is similar to a commitment transaction, but with no pending payments.

terms.title: Commitment_number
terms.definition: A 48-bit incrementing counter for each commitment transaction; counters are independent for each peer in the channel and start at 0.

terms.title: Commitment_revocation_private_key
terms.definition: Every commitment transaction has a unique commitment revocation private-key value that allows the other peer to spend all outputs immediately: revealing this key is how old commitment transactions are revoked.

terms.title: Commitment_transaction
terms.definition: A transaction that spends the funding transaction. Each peer holds the other peer's signature for this transaction, so that each always has a commitment transaction that it can spend. After a new commitment transaction is negotiated, the old one is revoked.

terms.title: Fail_the_channel
terms.definition: This is a forced close of the channel. Usually it requires signing and broadcasting the latest commitment transaction.

terms.title: Close_the_connection
terms.definition: This means closing communication with the peer (such as closing the TCP socket). It does not imply closing any channels with the peer.

terms.title: Final_node
terms.definition: The final recipient of a packet that is routing a payment from an origin node through some number of hops.

terms.title: Funding_transaction
terms.definition: An irreversible on-chain transaction that pays to both peers on a channel. It can only be spent by mutual consent.

terms.title: Hop
terms.definition: A node. Generally, an intermediate node lying between an origin node and a final node.

terms.title: HTLC
terms.definition: Hashed Time Locked Contract. A conditional payment between two peers.

terms.title: Invoice
terms.definition: A request for funds on the Lightning Network, possibly including payment type, payment amount, expiry, and other information.

terms.title: It's_ok_to_be_odd
terms.definition: A rule applied to some numeric fields that indicates either optional or compulsory support for features.

terms.title: MSAT
terms.definition: A millisatoshi, often used as a field name.

terms.title: Mutual_close
terms.definition: A cooperative close of a channel, accomplished by broadcasting an unconditional spend of the funding transaction with an output to each peer.

terms.title: Node
terms.definition: A computer or other device that is part of the Lightning network.

terms.title: Origin_node
terms.definition: The node that originates a packet that will route a payment through some number of hops to a final node.

terms.title: Outpoint
terms.definition: A transaction hash and output index that uniquely identify an unspent transaction output.

terms.title: Payment_hash
terms.definition: The HTLC contains the payment hash, which is the hash of the payment preimage.

terms.title: Payment_preimage
terms.definition: Proof that payment has been received, held by the final recipient, who is the only person who knows this secret.

terms.title: Peers
terms.definition: Two nodes that are in communication with each other.

terms.title: Penalty_transaction
terms.definition: A transaction that spends all outputs of a revoked commitment transaction, using the commitment revocation private key.

terms.title: Per-commitment_secret
terms.definition: Every commitment transaction derives its keys from a per-commitment secret, which is generated such that the series of per-commitment secrets for all previous commitments can be stored compactly.

terms.title: Processing_node
terms.definition: A node that is processing a packet that originated with an origin node and that is being sent toward a final node in order to route a payment.

terms.title: Receiving_node
terms.definition: A node that is receiving a message.

terms.title: Receiving_peer
terms.definition: A node that is receiving a message from a directly connected peer.

terms.title: Revoked_commitment_transaction
terms.definition: An old commitment transaction that has been revoked because a new commitment transaction has been negotiated.

terms.title: Revoked_transaction_close
terms.definition: An invalid close of a channel, accomplished by broadcasting a revoked commitment transaction.

terms.title: Route
terms.definition: A path across the Lightning Network that enables a payment from an origin node to a final node across one or more hops.

terms.title: Sending_node
terms.definition: A node that is sending a message.

terms.title: Sending_peer
terms.definition: A node that is sending a message to a directly connected peer.

terms.title: Unilateral_close
terms.definition: An uncooperative close of a channel, accomplished by broadcasting a commitment transaction.
